title: Is the Bible compatible with science? - Quora

response.answer_text: >> Is the Bible compatible with science? Absolutely 100%. There is absolutely no reason to reject the Bible based on observable science. What is not compatable with the Bible is evolution and the big hang. But evolution/big bang is not compatable with science either since it in no way, shape or form resembles science. It is a religious belief based on nothing but fantasy, not evidence. It takes a lot of faith in the beliefs of other people to accept evolution. If a person is honest, they'll admit that if they were told to prove evolution without referencing the teachings of others and could only be based on their own observations, there wouldn't be one person professing evolution to be true. Yet the unbeliever always demands that the Christian set the Bible down. You can’t agree to a fist fight and then tie your opponent’s hands behind their back, beat the ever-loving pulp out of them and then high-five yourself for winning the fight. You're only a big man when you cheat. If people want to believe that matter created itself by natural means even though science says it is impossible, whatever. But don't lie and cheat by calling it science. If people want to believe that life started by itself by natural means from nonliving, inorganic matter even though science says it is impossible, whatever. But don't lie and cheat by calling it science. If people want to believe that an oak tree can produce panda bears and frogs can turn into a prince even though observable science says it is impossible, whatever. But don't lie and cheat by calling it science. Call it a fairytale because fairytales are the only place one species changes to something conpletely different. The Bible is completely compatable with real science…science that is observable, testable and repeatable with consistent results every time. Evolutionism/big bang cosmology meets none of those requirements and is based solely on assumptions and biased beliefs…and that is not science no matter how badly someone wants it to be.
